summary: This appears to be an email or correspondence header from August 12, 2019, sent to or from the Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, regarding an 'AD order' (likely Administrative Detention or similar). The timing is significant as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center New York
persons.context: The recipient or sender of this correspondence regarding an 'AD order' at MCC New York.

events.title: Correspondence Regarding AD Order at MCC New York
events.description: An email or correspondence is sent regarding an 'AD order' (likely Administrative Detention order) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York
locations.context: The federal jail where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died; the location associated with the correspondence.

keyFacts: The document is dated August 12, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York.
It references an 'AD order,' which likely stands for Administrative Detention, a type of restrictive housing in federal prisons.
The correspondence involves the Associate Warden at MCC New York, indicating prison administrative activity on the day of Epstein's death.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it may be relevant to the circumstances surrounding his death or his detention conditions.
